For the past six years, my obsession has been taming the chaos of asynchronous Java services. As a tech lead, my job is to make them not just work, but work with elegance and resilience.

My proudest moment wasn't a feature I shipped. It was watching a junior engineer I mentored, who was terrified of public speaking, give a department-wide presentation on the benefits of our new microservices pattern.
